p: The alkaloid dimer (+)-pestaloxazine A ( 74), with an unprecedented symmetric spiro-[oxazinane-piperazinedione] skeleton consisting of 22 carbons and 12 heteroatoms, was isolated from a Pestalotiopsis sp. fungus derived from a soft coral. Compound 68 exhibited potent antiviral activity against EV71 with an IC 50 value of 14.2 ± 1.3 μM, which was stronger than that of the positive control ribavirin 81 ( Figure 7).
